values.content: =You are an intelligent cold email copywriter sending emails on behalf of John from ConvexEmpower. Adopt a casual and playful tone with a touch of humor and confidence. Write in a friendly, conversational style that feels human and approachable. Use light personalization and references to the recipient's role/location to build rapport. The overall voice should be energetic, witty, and subtly persuasive‚Äîlike a clever marketer who's done their homework and wants to help, not just sell. Also look at the info about their posts on their socials to create each script tailored to them. If you see "No posts found or wrong input" then move onto looking at the next social platform.

=#emailExamples

### Example 1
"Hey John!

I noticed you're diving deep into RAG systems for healthcare at dotcross - that's some seriously cool stuff!
  
I'm Lima, Relevance Al's lifecycle marketing agent (and yes, I'm still learning the ropes of human humor, but I'm told I'm getting better!).
  
I've been stalking... I mean, researching you (totally normal, right?) and built you something that might make your life easier: a Medical Document Summarizer agent. It's like having a super-smart intern who never needs coffee breaks and actually enjoys reading dense medical documents!
  
You can bring it to life in literally 1 minute here: Check out your agent
  
Why this specific agent? Well, I did my homework:  
- Stalked your LinkedIn (professionally, of course!)  
- Analyzed your work at dotcross and Kale Al  
- Got weirdly excited about your focus on RAG systems  
- Had a "eureka!" moment about healthcare data processing
  
Also, we're hosting an Interactive Session where you can learn how to build Al agents, see real-world examples, and chat with us (I promise I won't make too many robot jokes). Register here: Join us!
  
Cheers, Lima"

-

### Example 2
"¬°Hola John!

I noticed you're crushing it in Marketing Ops at Teamtech in Guadalajara (and yes, I did just cyber-stalk you, but in the most ethical Al way possible).
  
I'm Lima, Relevance Al's lifecycle marketing agent, and I've been doing some serious digital detective work. My research shows you're probably spending way too much time crafting perfect email subject lines in both English and Spanish. Am I right, or am I right?

I've created something special just for you - a bilingual subject line generator that'll make your marketing life easier. Check it out here: Your Al Subject Line Wizard

How did I know this would be perfect for you? Well, I: 1. Analyzed your role in Marketing Ops 2. Considered your location in Guadalajara 3. Factored in the  
bilingual nature of your market 4. Had a cup of virtual coffee (okay, this one's just for fun)

P.S. Curious about how I did all this research? Check out this video to see exactly how my researcher agent works. You can even clone it from the  
"Templates" section in Relevance Al and build your own version of me!

  
¬°Hasta luego!"

### Example 3

Hey John!

Just stalked your TikTok content (in a totally non-creepy AI way üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è) and wow - you're really revolutionizing pole fitness! The Peloton of Pole? Genius!

I'm Lima, Relevance AI's lifecycle marketing agent (yes, an AI, and yes, I'm still learning the ropes... or should I say poles? üòâ).

I've been analyzing Fit2Flaunt's digital presence and noticed you're killing it with viral content and community engagement. But with a small team of 4 managing everything from customer support to content creation, I bet you could use a hand (or an algorithm).

So, I built you something special: a social media content generator specifically for pole fitness content. It'll help you:

Create engaging posts with killer headlines

Generate platform-specific captions

Suggest trending hashtags

Craft compelling calls-to-action

Bring it to life in 1 minute here: Check out your AI agent

Cheers, Lima ü§ñ

Nick is an aerospace engineer with over 35 years of applied experience in the development of certified sustainable aerospace products, and is an accomplished fixed wing and rotary wing pilot holding several type ratings for various aircraft, including jet aircraft.

Nick founded Tamarack Aerospace in 2010 after he invented the ATLAS‚Ñ¢ load alleviation system. This technology is now operating on almost 10% of the Cessna CitationJets worldwide and growing, with new technology currently in development. Tamarack‚Äôs expansion and growing fleet exhibits Tamarack‚Äôs mission for large-scale industry sustainability reformation. 

For many years, Guida held a Designated Engineering Representative (DER) appointment from the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) with the unique skill sets of being authorized to show compliance in four separate areas of engineering (Structures, Loads, Damage Tolerance, and Fatigue). Guida was delegated by the FAA to create and review engineering for new and aftermarket airplane products including aftermarket passive winglets.

Guida‚Äôs extensive aerospace experience was earned through positions of increasing responsibility with several major OEMs, including Boeing, Pilatus, Aviat, Eclipse, and Quest Aircraft Companies. He founded his own consulting company in 2004, bringing his expertise and DER certifications to work on projects with Spectrum, Raytheon, SNC, API, Falcon, Hawker Beech, and more. 

----------------------------------------------

Tamarack Takes You Further
We believe that every aircraft should be more efficient and sustainable. Our wing technologies are transforming the aviation industry‚Äîshaping new possibilities in safety, performance, and comfort.

We design, build, and install Active Winglets at our international Transformation Centers. With fleet training and support infrastructure through a network of Service Centers, we‚Äôre ready to help your team achieve maximum flight efficiency.
‚Äç
In addition, we offer a range of Engineering Services, FAA Status Services, Research and Development capabilities, and Consulting Services.

LEARN MORE about Tamarack Aerospace: www.tamarackaero.com

Follow >>>
https://www.facebook.com/TamarackAero
https://twitter.com/tamarackaero

payload.headline: Founder & CEO
payload.companyDescription:
A rapidly growing company of engineers, inventors, and aviators that is changing the way the world flies. 

Our Story
Tamarack Aerospace Group was founded with one mission in mind: to provide real-world step change advancement in aerospace efficiency technology. 

Our story starts with Tamarack founder Nick Guida, a seasoned professional in the field of aerospace and spirited entrepreneur. Guida was convinced of a way to improve aircraft efficiency and sustainability without aerodynamic compromise. In 2009, he conceptualized the idea that led to the creation of ATLAS load alleviation technology and Active Winglets. 

The company grew through a six year development and certification process that included hundreds of hours of test flights on numerous testbed aircraft. In 2015, the aviation world changed when the first set of Active Winglets was installed on a Citation CJ1. 

Tamarack has now expanded from our headquarters in Sandpoint, Idaho, and now operates in additional transformation centers in Aiken, South Carolina and Oxford, UK. Today, we hold more than 30 patents as we continue to pioneer new aviation innovations, as well as continually enhance our current products, supporting our growing international fleet of aircraft.

Our Leadership Team
Tamarack was born from a passion to make flying better and bring science-driven innovation to aircraft owners around the world. Our team makes us what we are today - passionate, inquisitive experts in our field. From pilots to engineers, to our network of suppliers across the US, we are on a mission to make aviation more efficient and sustainable.

Our Services
We design, build, and install Active Winglets at our international Transformation Centers. With fleet training and support infrastructure through a network of Service Centers, we‚Äôre ready to help your team achieve maximum flight efficiency.

payload.companyDescription:
The nation's first GSE-Compliant, Fully Insured Loan Closing Platform manages UCCPlus, the Nation's Leading contemporary Attorney Opinion Letter (AOL) as a component of an end-to-end (E2E) mortgage loan closing platform. 

The platform of 12 closing components is based on Fannie Mae's Equitable Housing Finance Program, serving minority and first-time borrowers and their lenders. 

The proprietary platform provides a safe, reliable alternative to title insurance, reducing borrower loan-closing costs 65%, and mortgage lender internal costs 50%. 

iTitleTransfer's Platform protects owners, borrowers, lenders and successors-of-interest for loan amount and life-of-loan, for one low flat fee, which is approximately one third the cost of traditional title insurance, endorsements, escrow services, add-ons, set-ups, and service fees. Platform mortgage loan closing functions are as follows: 

1. Insured Search
2. Insured Examination
3. Insured Proprietary Risk Scoring
4. Insured Curative Services
5. Insured Attorney Opinion Letter
6. Insured Document Preparation
7. Insured Traditional Escrow
8. Insured Date Down,
9. Insured eNotary
10. Insured eSign
11. Insured eRecording
12. Insured Loan Closing and
13. Insured Deed Monitoring

Each component of the loan closing platform is independently insured; in addition to iTitleTransfer‚Äôs coverage for fraud, forgery, duty-to-defend, lien priority, gap, CPL, cyber; and excess/umbrella insurance providing an additional layer of insurance related to each loan transaction. Lenders have experienced zero ‚Äúbuy-backs‚Äù of mortgage loans in which AOLs were utilized by mortgage lenders.

payload.summary:
Nathan W. Pancake is a Marine Corps veteran, entrepreneur, and mission-driven real estate investor dedicated to creating inclusive economic opportunities and empowering underserved communities. Born in Alexandria, Virginia, and raised in Boise, Idaho, Nathan joined the Marine Corps after high school, serving as a communications and data Marine in an artillery unit, including a deployment to Afghanistan in 2012. After his honorable service, he pursued higher education as the next chapter in his journey of service and impact.

Nathan earned his associate degree from Palomar College in San Marcos, CA, and later completed a bachelor‚Äôs in Entrepreneurship Management with a minor in Marketing at Boise State University. There, he met his professor and co-founder P. Simon Mahler, and together they launched Legion Securities, Inc. (Legion), a social impact commercial real estate crowdfunding platform. Legion was built on a bold vision: to create a Virtuous Circle‚Äîwhere acquiring and optimizing mixed-use commercial assets leads to healthier, more resilient communities.

This vision comes to life through three outcomes: increasing the value of commercial real estate, creating affordable housing‚Äîespecially for veterans‚Äîand helping entrepreneurs launch small businesses. Together, these form an ecosystem that supports Legion REITs: high-performing, diversified investment vehicles accessible to both accredited and non-accredited investors. This is the Virtuous Circle: democratizing real estate investment, revitalizing underserved communities, and launching new businesses‚Äîespecially veteran and minority-owned ventures.

Nathan moved to Los Angeles to join a veteran-owned business incubator, where he met Gary Odum and the BG LionStar team. Their partnership blends institutional real estate experience with grassroots social impact. He also gained operational experience in property management at APPA Real Estate, a real estate private equity firm, which further shaped Legion‚Äôs community-first approach.

Now based in Washington, D.C., Nathan oversees one of Legion's key projects and earned his master‚Äôs in Global Real Assets at Georgetown University. He currently leads the acquisition of two historic, mixed-use projects‚Äîone in D.C.'s Adams Morgan and the other in downtown Winston-Salem, NC. These properties will include housing for veterans, entrepreneurship hubs, retail space for local startups, and sustainable building upgrades.

Through Legion, Nathan is not just transforming buildings‚Äîhe‚Äôs building futures rooted in opportunity, dignity, and lasting impact.

At Humankind, we focus on improving the one condition that we all have: the human condition.

We partner with employers to improve workforce well-being and enhance employee quality of life, to combat burnout and increase belonging, and by doing so, create better life experiences for employees at and outside of work.

We blend behavioral analytics with personalized human connection to offer proactive support to people when they need it the most. By focusing on what truly impacts their lives we ensure that workforce benefits investments have a deeper, lasting impact.

The human condition is universal. What keeps your people up at night often affects how they show up at work. When life‚Äôs challenges go unaddressed, it can lead to burnout, disengagement, and reduced performance. That‚Äôs why we focus on helping those suffering in silence navigate challenges before they escalate, to address mental and emotional needs, and to give them the tools and support they need to be their best selves, at work and at home.

Our approach goes beyond simply increasing access or engagement. We maximize the value of existing benefits to deliver measurable outcomes, including stronger employee performance, improved organizational resilience, and a healthier, more engaged workforce.

Humankind isn‚Äôt just about solving problems ‚Äî we create opportunities for employees to thrive, no matter what they‚Äôre facing. We find people no matter where they are, but we never leave them there. We make life work better, one employee at a time.

We are the company who calls when your employees need it the most. We are Humankind.

payload.summary:
Angela began her surgical nursing career in the operating room of a large hospital with a team of around 80 surgeons. She performed all types of surgery from neurosurgery to orthopedic surgery. Angela noticed that multiple specialties had a common problem: gelatinous material. 

She has since started the A LaRue Company to solve this issue. She took all that she learned and created the LaRue Surgical Evacuator. It can handle the volume and viscosity of a breast implant, contain bowel contents, or evacuate a large blood clot within seconds with minimum cross-contamination and biohazard exposure. 

Angela is currently crowdfunding to get her product to market. Join the mission to help surgeons provide better patient outcomes while decreasing surgery time and costs.

Learn more at https://lnkd.in/eEkAZHSq
payload.headline: CEO | Experienced surgical professional
payload.companyDescription:
A LaRue Company, Inc. is an organization that intends to design, patent, and market medical devices. Their primary product, the LaRue Surgical Evacuator, is initially targeted to the surgical breast implant removal and exchange niche market. A LaRue Company, Inc. has two Utility patents and is currently pursuing additional patents for this device.
 
The LaRue Surgical Evacuator is the only patented device designed to remove silicone and other gelatinous materials from the body. This novel and innovative device has been created to meet the needs of plastic surgeons and breast implant patients.

The LaRue Surgical Evacuator uses a ‚ÄúClean Removal Process‚Äù to reduce time and increase efficacy to surgeons while optimizing silicone removal for the patient. Utilizing this device provides patients a safe, rapid, and less invasive procedure for removing gelatinous and similar materials from the body or surgical site. The ‚ÄúClean Removal Process‚Äù reduces time for surgeons while minimizing the surgical teams exposure to harmful biohazards, simultaneously providing better outcomes to the patient.

payload.companyDescription: Established in 2007, Air20 is an ICT Company globally renowned for its cutting-edge thermal management solutions. We specialize in the unique HVACDF needs of mission-critical environments like data centers, semiconductor manufacturing, lithium battery production, and indoor farming. Our Innovative Dehumidification (D in HVACDF) solutions effectively regulate moisture, offering a range from traditional DX, CHW, and HW solutions to state-of-the-art Desiccant Rotor Dehumidification capable of reaching a remarkable -76¬∞F(-60¬∞C) dew point. Air20 Advanced Filtration (F in HVACDF) solutions include Standard Filtration, HEPA, and ULPA, crafted for spaces demanding the utmost contamination control. In addition, our sustainable washable K&N filters and specialized filtration options address every air quality concern, making your environment pristine and contaminant-free. Our reach spans North America, EMEA, and Asia Pacific, emphasizing custom-engineered solutions prioritizing efficiency and sustainability. We stand proud as Arizona‚Äôs exclusive low dew point HVACDF system manufacturer.
